name: WASP-107
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-107 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-107 is a star with 0.69 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.66 times its radius. It is located 211.54 light years away from the solar system.

WASP-107 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-107 system


WASP-107 b

WASP-107 b was discovered by the SuperWASP-South observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WASP-107 b is 38.16 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-107 b is 10.536 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, WASP-107 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-107, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by SuperWASP-South.
